name: Victory Level 1: Inflict Minor Injury
desc: Inflict a Minor Injury causing -1d to STR/RFX/INT governed Dice Pools. The injury will naturally heal over the next few days, or faster if treated actively.

name: Victory Level 1: Stagger
desc: The opponent gains the Staggered condition until the end of the next round. This could be sand thrown in a character's face, being shoulder-checked, or losing their footing.

name: Victory Level 1: Shove
desc: The opponent is shoved in the desired direction. The character performing the shove can either roll a Lift check or take the average amount of Wins rounded down. If the character is using magic, they may use a Magic Skill instead of Lift, assuming the magic could shove someone. For each win achieved, the character can shove another character 5 feet in a straight line. For each size category the opponent is smaller than you, double the distance. For each size category, the opponent is larger than you, half the distance. The Narrator can change the shove distance based on unusual circumstances (i.e. humanoid-sized creature weighs as much as a Large sized creature as it is made of pure metal/stone).

name: Victory Level 1: Grapple!
desc: Enter/exit a Grapple. If entering into a Grapple, apply the Grappled condition to both you and your opponent.

name: Victory Level 1: Drag
desc: The opponent, which first must be Grappled, is dragged in a desired direction. The character performing the drag can either roll a Lift check or take the average amount of wins rounded down. If the character is using magic, they may use a Magic Skill instead of Lift, assuming the magic could drag someone. For each win achieved, a character can drag another character 10 feet. For each size category the opponent is smaller than you, double the distance. For each Size the opponent is larger than you, half the distance. If the character is required to move during the drag, they may not exceed thier Movement Speed for that round. The Narrator can change the drag distance based on unusual circumstances (i.e. humanoid-sized creature weighs as much as a Large sized creature as it is made of pure metal/stone).

name: Victory Level 2: Inflict Medium Injury
desc: Inflict a Medium Injury causing -2d to STR/RFX/INT governed Dice Pools. The injury must be treated relatively soon otherwise further penalties may apply such as infection.

name: Victory Level 2: Disarm
desc: The opponent loses one of their held weapons.

name: Victory Level 3: Inflict Serious Injury
desc: Inflict a Serious Injury causing -3d to STR/RFX/INT governed Dice Pools.  The injury will lead to death in time if untreated.

name: Victory Level 3: Double Disarm
desc: The opponent loses two of their held weapons.

name: Victory Level 3: Trip
desc: The opponent gains the Prone condition. A character can declare they are attempting to get up on a round they start prone. Getting up requires the downed opponent to use their entire movement speed. They can regain their footing and remove the Prone condition at the end of the round they were getting up. Instead of getting up, a character can remain prone and crawl. They use their Climb Movement Speed to crawl instead of their movement speed.

name: Victory Level 4: Inflict Fatal Injury
desc: Inflict a Fatal Injury causing -4d to STR/RFX/INT governed Dice Pools. The injury will lead to death very soon if untreated. The character inflicted with this injury is Incapacitated (see the Narrative Effect).

name: Victory Level 4: Dismember
desc: The opponent loses an arm or leg, which counts as a Serious Injury. Not available to ranged combat rolls unless there is a narrative explanation of how a ranged attack could dismember (magic, explosive projectiles, etc...).

name: Victory Level 4: Render Unconscious
desc: The opponent gains the Unconscious condition, which counts as a Medium Injury that persists even after they regain consciousness. This could be from head trauma, blood chokes, etc...

name: Victory Level 5: Inflict Death Blow
desc: Inflict a Death Blow Injury causing -5d to STR/RFX/INT governed Dice Pools. The injury causes death.

name: Combat Modifier: Grapple Disarm
desc: Once already in a Grapple, as part of their declaration phase a character can declare they are attempting a Grapple Disarm to disarm their opponent. The character attempting the Grapple Disarm must be Unarmed. They gain Advantage thier Unarmed combat roll versus the armed grappled opponent. The armed opponent gains Disadvantage on their combat roll versus the character grappling them. The character attempting the Grapple Disarm may only take the Disarm Level 2 Victory (this means they cannot delegate their attack to inflict an injury or execute a trip regardless of how high the victory achieved.)

name: Condition: Staggered
desc: Disadvantage on checks that require coordinated movement (i.e. Combat Rolls, Evasion Rolls, Dexterity, Athletics, etc...). Movement Speed is halved.

name: Condition: Blinded
desc: Disadvantage on checks that majorly relies on sight (i.e. Combat Rolls, Evasion Rolls, Dexterity, Athletics, etc...). Automatically fails any check that requires sight.

name: Condition: Charmed
desc: Disadvantage on checks that involve resisting the charmer's influence. Can't cause harm to the charmer.

name: Condition: Deafened
desc: Disadvantage on checks that majorly relies on hearing. Automatically fails any check that requires hearing.

name: Condition: Frightened
desc: Disadvantage on all checks while the source of the fear is within line of sight. Can't willingly move closer towards the source of fear.

name: Condition: Invisible
desc: Disadvantage on Combat Rolls against this character if they majorly rely on sight. Impossible to see via traditional sight and is considered Heavily Obscured. Can still be detected via hearing, touch, smell, other special senses, or magic senses.

name: Condition: Grappled
desc: Disadvantage on checks that require coordinated movement (i.e. Combat Rolls, Evasion Rolls, Dexterity, Athletics, etc...), except against grappler. Can't move, unless through Grapple Move. Close Melee Combat Rolls can be used in a Grapple. Medium Melee Combat Rolls can be used against Reach Melee Combat Rolls in a Grapple. All other Combat Rolls are considered an Unarmed Combat Roll in a Grapple. Defense from armor is not applicable if narratively bypassable while in a Grapple. Ends if the grappler is Incapacitated.

name: Condition: Prone
desc: Disadvantage on rolls that generally assumes a character is standing (i.e. Combat Rolls, Evasion Rolls, Dexterity, Athletics, etc...). Disadvantage on ranged Combat Rolls made against a Prone character if the Narrator believes they would be smaller target. For instance, shooting a prone opponent 10 feet away wouldn't have Disadvantage. However, shooting a prone sniper at range who is making themselves a small target would incur Disadvantage. Only able to crawl using their Climb Movement Speed.

name: Condition: Restrained
desc: Disadvantage on any checks that require coordinated movement (i.e. Combat Rolls, Evasion Rolls, Dexterity, Athletics,  etc...). Can't move.

name: Condition: Incapacitated
desc: Automatically fail any check that requires moving their body (i.e. Combat Rolls, Evasion Rolls, Dexterity, Athletics,  etc...). Can't move.

name: Condition: Stunned
desc: Incapacitated (see the Narrative Effect). Can't coherently speak.

name: Condition: Paralyzed
desc: Incapacitated (see the Narrative Effect). Can't speak. Aware of surroundings. The character becomes rigid.

name: Condition: Unconscious
desc: Incapacitated (see the Narrative Effect). Can't speak. Unaware of surroundings. The character drops whatever they are holding and falls prone (see the Narrative Effect).

name: Condition: Petrified
desc: Incapacitated (see the Narrative Effect). Character is transformed, along with any non-magical object it is wearing or carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone). Its weight increases by a factor of ten, and it ceases aging. Can't speak. Serious Resistance to all damage. Complete Resistance to poison, necrosis, and disease, although a poison, necrosis, or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized.

name: Space Vacuum Life Support
desc: Enable the user to survive in the vacuum of space until onboard oxygen depletes.

name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: Acts as a Spellcasting Focus for spells.

name: Magic Resource Leech
desc: Sneak attack regain 1 Magic Resource of the user's choice.

name: Life Leech
desc: Sneak attacks trigger an Minor Heal to self.

name: Minorly Enhanced Magic Resource
desc: +2 to magic Resource capacity.

name: Enhanced Magic Resource
desc: +4 to magic Resource capacity.

name: Greatly Enhanced Magic Resource
desc: +6 to magic Resource capacity.

name: Ariel Assassin
desc: While performing an aerial attack, gain a +1 to your victory level.

name: Minorly Enhanced Vitality
desc: Reduce up to 1d6 of total injury penalty dice.

name: Enhanced Vitality
desc: Reduce up to 2d6 of total injury penalty dice.

name: Greatly Enhanced Vitality
desc: Reduce up to 3d6 of total injury penalty dice.

name: Enhanced Critical
desc: +1 automatic win to sneak attacks and incapacitated opponents.

name: Dragon Threat Sense
desc: The character gets an uneasy feeling when there are draconic creatures near.

name: Dragon Breath Resistance
desc: Minor Resistance vs dragon elemental attacks (Dragonfire, Dragontide, Soulfire, ect)

name: Enhanced Healing
desc: Any healing acts as the tier above.

name: Blessing of the Moon
desc: INT is set to level 2. Gain the following disabling: "I hear the sword whispering its secrets to me, and I must know them"

name: Innate Mind Reading
desc: Magically access the surface thoughts of a creature within 60 ft as long as concentration isn't broken. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead obstruct the ability. While reading the mind of a create, gains advantage to Communication checks versus the creature.

name: Spore Follower
desc: Without the presence of a spore evolved, this creature will behave as a brain dead monster. But under direction will follow orders and use weapons.

name: Spore Carrier
desc: Carries the spore fungal infection. Creatures injured are infected with the spore disease. Upon death, the fungal growth hardens into a brittle stone like substance.

name: Incorporeal Form
desc: Can move through physical objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain.

name: Ending
desc: Creatures killed with this weapon are instantly decapitated.

name: Splinter
desc: Any weapon dice added to a combat roll are considered automatic wins when attacking a plant based creature (Leshens, Nature Dragons) or wooden structures.

name: Extendable Weapon
desc: This weapon can shrink to the size of a small weapon, extend up to reach weapon, as well as any size between. The force of the weapon extending can be used in a variety of way.

name: Fire Repair and Enhancement
desc: Weapons repairs in intense fires. If fully repaired and is exposed to increasingly intense flames, it will become a higher tier item. Each time it is upgraded, a more intense fire is required upgrade it.

name: Apparel Storage
desc: This small mirror can save an outfit the user is wearing. If no outfit is stored inside the user will appear naked in the reflection while holding it. Pressing the mirror while looking into it will swap your apparel between your reflection and what you are currently wearing. This happens in a flash of light, similar to the glare off a mirror. This allows the users to store an outfit inside of the necklace.

name: Retractable Shield
desc: The user can deploy or retract the medium shield at will.

name: Light Bound
desc: This weapon is physical light, and can be absorbed and summoned by a those with the Radiance magic skill.

name: Metal Feeding
desc: To repair, item can feed on metal. Different amounts result in different levels of repair and time needed to complete these repairs.

name: Command Asclepius
desc: By holding and speaking the command word "Asclepius" the user may instruct this Runecraft to perform various simple actions. "Asclepius, turn into a whip, or short spear." or Asclepius, attack those soldiers."

name: Swordbreaker Blade Catch
desc: Any weapon that could reasonably be caught in the swordbreaker can be caught with a Lvl 1 victory, entering into Close Quarters combat. The opponent's weapon is usable while bound. Your main hand weapon (Small, Medium, or Large) can be used in this Close Quarters combat scenario.

name: Indestructible
desc: This item can't lose durability.

name: Moonlight Greatsword
desc: Just by thought, this ancient sword wreathed in moonlight, becoming a greatsword wreathed in moonlight. While active, it becomes a greatsword and now additionally deals radiant damage.

name: Binding of the Moon
desc: This weapon can only be picked up by those who sing (out loud or in their head) the Lullaby of the Moon. If the weapon is held for a fortnight, the weapon is bound to the users, severing the bond with the previous bearer. The bearer can now dismiss and summon the blade at will.

name: Phenomena Detection
desc: Beats and lights up when turned towards supernatural phenomena in an area. Beats faster the closer it is.

name: Forbidden Whispers
desc: When one squeezes the Heart, it whispers secrets directly into their mind concerning the current area, as it senses information about the world beyond mortal recognition. When the Heart is pointed at a person, it reveals secrets about them. Roll a destiny roll (a d20) to determine the level of information obtained.

name: Light Storage
desc: Holds 1 Magic Resource worth of light. Can be recharged in Sunlight. Light slowly dissipates from this gem.

name: Retractable Shield
desc: The user can deploy or retract the medium shield at will.

name: Defense Spells
desc: The staff is endowed with 10 charges, serving as the fuel for the enclosed spells. When holding the staff, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from it, provided you have a vocation that can unlock the magic required for these spells: Physical Protection (1 charge) or Mage Shield (2 charges). No components are necessary. At the break of dawn, the staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges. Should the staff exhaust its charges entirely, roll a d20. If the result is 1, the staff shatters and meets its destruction.

name: Single-use Invisibility
desc: Applies the Invisibility Spell to the user of this item after being used. Item is destroyed in the process.

name: Draupnir
desc: This ring can transform between a weapon and ring. The ring is endowed with 10 charges. With the ring equipped, the user can force a duplication resulting in either a ring or weapon, both which appear in the users hand. Duplicates can not transform, only the original. At the break of dawn, the ring regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges.

name: Cold Enchantment
desc: Weapon additionally deals Cold damage.

name: The Anatoli Curse
desc: The weapon is cursed on an individual, always return to the user no matter how the weapon is disposed. When this item is used in combat, the bearer becomes blood lusted with each subsequent kill, becoming increasingly bestially minded, possibly even attack friends.

name: Gradual Healing
desc: Minor injuries heal in 1 day, others are downgraded in following days if maintained.

name: Minor Healing Factor
desc: Minor injuries heal in a short rest. Medium injuries heal durning a long rest. A stabilized Serious injuries heal over a 24 hour rest. Cannot effect higher tier injuries.

name: Continuous Minor Healing Factor
desc: Minor injuries heal in a short rest. Medium injuries heal durning a long rest. A stabilized Serious injuries heal over a 24 hour rest. Cannot effect higher tier injuries.

name: Minor Heal
desc: Removes a minor injury. For a higher tier injury, reduce the dice penalty of the injury by 1. Injury remains at its current tier. Further minor heals have no effect.

name: Medium Heal
desc: Removes a medium or lesser injury. For a higher tier injury, reduce the dice penalty of the injury by 2. Injury remains at its current tier. Further medium healing has no effect.

name: Serious Heal
desc: Removes a serious or lesser injury. For a higher tier injury, reduce the dice penalty of the injury by 3. Injury remains at its current tier. Further serious healing has no effect.

name: Fatal Heal
desc: Removes a Fatal or lesser injury. Can be used to reattach limbs as long as the limb is not destroyed.

name: Revival Heal
desc: Return a dead character to life with a serious injury. Can only be performed within minutes of death. For living characters, it completely heals all injuries, regrowing body parts, and returning the body to peak performance.

name: Keen Hearing
desc: Advantage on hearing based Perception checks.

name: Keen Smell
desc: Advantage on smell based Perception checks.

name: Keen Sight
desc: Advantage on sight based Perception checks.

name: Vision: Darkvision
desc: Within 60 feet, sees dim light as if it were bright light and darkness as if it were dim light, though devoid of color.

name: Vision: Enhanced Darkvision
desc: Within 120 feet, sees dim light as if it were bright light and darkness as if it were dim light, though devoid of color.

name: Vision: Blindsight
desc: Within 30 ft, the environment can be perceived without the need for sight.

name: Vision: Truesight
desc: A being possessing truesight can, within a designated range, perceive both in regular and magical darkness, observe invisible entities and objects, effortlessly discern visual illusions, succeed on skill checks against them, and discern the true form of a shapechanger or a creature altered by magic. Additionally, this creature has the ability to see into the Ethereal Plane.

name: Light: Glow
desc: Provides 20 ft radius bright light and 40 ft radius dim light.

name: Language: Babelish
desc: Can speak and write Babelish.

name: Language: Bright-speak
desc: Can speak and write Bright-speak.

name: Language: Pirish
desc: Can speak and write Pirish.

name: Language - Deep-speak
desc: Can speak and write Deep-speak.

name: Language: Primal
desc: Can speak and write Primal.

name: Language: Kikishi
desc: Can speak and write Kikishi.

name: Language: Draconic
desc: Can speak and write Draconic.

name: Language: Demonic
desc: Can speak and write Demonic.

name: Disabling: Amnesia
desc: Character is missing a large portion of their past.

name: Disabling: Missing bodily extremity/limb
desc: STR and RFX dice penalties when performing tasks requiring 2 hands.

name: Disabling: Feeble
desc: STR is set to -1

name: Disabling: Heavy
desc: RFX is set to -1

name: Disabling: Dim-witted
desc: INT is set to -1

name: Disabling: Phobia
desc: Debilitating fear of ?.

name: Disabling: Extreme Prejudice
desc: Overwhelming hatred/disgust of ?.

name: Disabling: Compulsive Liar
desc: Compulsion to lie about self-aggrandizing claims/achievements.

name: Disabling: Kleptomaniac
desc: Desire to steal most things regardless of value.

name: Disabling: Betrayal Paranoia
desc: Extreme belief that every person met will betray them.

name: Disabling: Government Paranoia
desc: Extreme belief that the ruling class is run by an evil cult.

name: Disabling: Superstition Paranoia
desc: Extreme belief in common superstition and old wives tales.

name: Disabling: Paranoia
desc: Irrational belief that ...

name: Disabling: Loose Cannon
desc: Overwhelming predisposition towards rage/anger.

name: Disabling: Incontrollable Grief
desc: Overwhelming grief that is triggered reminder of past trauma.

name: Disabling: Very Forgetful
desc: Often forgets plans, directions, people, items,  names...

name: Disabling: Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in , cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Endurance Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Endurance, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Athletics Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Athletics, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Lift Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Lift, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Perception Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Perception, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Dexterity Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Dexterity, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Stealth Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Stealth, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: General Knowledge Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in General Knowledge, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Will Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Will, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Communication Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in Communication, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Incapable of Lying
desc: (Specific parameters required, see Cogent website for examples)

name: Disabling: Addiction
desc: Extreme addiction, suffers from withdrawals if not satisfied.

name: Disabling: Delusion
desc: Belief of something to be real beyond the scope of simple faith.

name: Disabling: Imperceptive
desc: Disadvantage to environmental Perception rolls.

name: Disabling: Blind
desc: Unable to make sight based perception checks.

name: Disabling: Deaf
desc: Unable to make hearing based perception checks.

name: Disabling: Anosmia
desc: Unable to make smell based perception checks.

name: Disabling: Ageusia
desc: Unable to make taste based perception checks.

name: Disabling: Anaphia
desc: Unable to make touch based perception checks.

name: Disabling: Gullible
desc: Disadvantage versus deceptive communication rolls.

name: Disabling: Impressionable
desc: Disadvantage versus persuasive communication rolls.

name: Disabling: People Pleaser
desc: Always try to make other people happy, even at their own expense.

name: Disabling: SKILL Overconfidence
desc: Extremely overconfident in SKILL, cannot invest in.

name: Disabling: Illiterate
desc: Can't read or write.

name: Disabling: Overly Nostalgic
desc: Constantly reminiscing about the good old day.

name: Size: Tiny
desc: 2.5x2.5 ft on battle map.

name: Size: Small
desc: 5x5 ft on battle map.

name: Size: Medium
desc: 5x5 ft on battle map.

name: Size: Large
desc: 10x10 ft on battle map.

name: Size: Huge
desc: 15x15 ft on battle map.

name: Size: Gargantuan
desc: 20x20 ft on battle map.

name: Destiny Resistance
desc: "Post Roll Destiny Points" cannot be spent against this character.

name: Destiny Immunity
desc: Destiny Points cannot be spent against this character.

name: Condition Immunities:
desc: Character is immune to the specified conditions.

name: Minor Weakness: (Damage Type)
desc: +1 to the level of injury received from damage type.

name: Medium Weakness: (Damage Type)
desc: +2 to the level of injury received from damage type.

name: Serious Weakness: (Damage Type)
desc: +3 to the level of injury received from damage type.

name: Fatal Weakness: (Damage Type)
desc: +4 to the level of injury received from damage type.

name: Minor Resistance: (Damage Type)
desc: -1 to victory levels received from damage type.

name: Medium Resistance: (Damage Type)
desc: -2 to victory levels received from damage type.

name: Serious Resistance: (Damage Type)
desc: -3 to victory levels received from damage type.

name: Fatal Resistance: (Damage Type)
desc: -4 to victory levels received from damage type.

name: Complete Resistance: (Damage Type)
desc: Negate victory levels received from damage type.
